description:
About rhode: rhode is a line of curated skincare essentials. Formulated for a variety of skin types and needs with high performance ingredients, it's a daily routine that nourishes your skin barrier over time.

Accounting Manager Overview & Responsibilities

  • Month-end and Year-end Close: Take a leading role in executing the month-end and year-end closing processes, including AP and AR reconciliations, fixed assets and prepaid expenses, accruals, and bank reconciliations.
  • Accounts Payable: Process and code invoices, ensuring they hit the right budget lines. Serve as the primary point of contact for vendors, responding to payment inquiries.
  • Financial Reporting: Prepare monthly financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with GAAP.
  • Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline financial processes and enhance efficiency, implementing improvements as appropriate.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with colleagues in other departments, such as marketing, operations, and product development, to support their financial needs and provide insights to drive business decisions.
  • Audit support: Serve as a point of contact for external auditors, providing requested documentation and support as needed.

To be successful:

  • Financial systems literate, with strong experience in accounting and third-party systems.
  • Strong Excel (index match, formatting, look-ups) abilities and proficiencies in managing large data sets.
  • Preferred Netsuite and Bill.com experience.
  • Get it done attitude, solutions-oriented problem solver.
  • Takes radical accountability and ownership over their duties and responsibilities.
  • Intellectually curious, with a genuine desire and drive to improve the business.
  • Commutable 3 days a week to Beverly Hills with the ability to come in more often as needed.

Qualifications:

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Accounting, Finance, or relevant field.

Work Experience:

  • Minimum of 3-5 years of overall GAAP accrual-based accounting experience.

The annual salary for this position is between $105,000 - $115,000, depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate. This role is based out of our headquarters in Los Angeles, CA.
